title: Museum Space Design Project Incorporating Scientific Inquiry Based on Early Childhood Cognitive Development Stages

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced science education theories (inquiry process, variable control, evidence-based analysis), proficiency in high-level VR technology applications, and research methodologies in early childhood cognitive development
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers design child-friendly museum spaces in VR simulations, acquiring scientific inquiry design principles applicable to real educational settings (hypothesis-testing environment construction, evidence-based conclusion spaces, integration of scientific analysis tools).

learning_goals: Identify and explain at least three spatial design elements suitable for the cognitive development stages of early childhood (sensorimotor and preoperational stages), incorporating scientific inquiry components (observation, experimentation, hypothesis formation, variable control).
Design interactive exhibition elements (adjustable variable manipulation, evidence-gathering activities, data analysis) using VR simulation tools to stimulate exploratory behaviors in young children.

Within four weeks, learners analyze three design trends, two literary works, and one cognitive development study to complete a theme-based museum space design project (including floor plans, 3D modeling, and explanatory materials) reflecting the scientific inquiry process (experimental design, measurement, analysis, conclusion). They achieve over 80% in four out of five expert evaluation rubric criteria.

resources: Early Childhood Cognitive Development Theory Textbook

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
